com.tractrac.clientmodule

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tractrac.clientmodule.details.Attachments
      • com.tractrac.clientmodule.details.IdBase
        • com.tractrac.clientmodule.details.IdBaseNamed
          • com.tractrac.clientmodule.Event

  • public class Event
extends IdBaseNamed
    Encapsulates data related to an Event: Races, Competitors, Competitor Classes, Control points, Routes.

    Given a key-value configuration source, KeyValue.setup(java.net.URL) can be used instead of a manual setup.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    TracTrac
    See Also:
    KeyValue.setup(java.net.URL), Race, Competitor, CompetitorClass, ControlPoint, Route

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event(java.util.UUID id, java.lang.String name)
      Creates an event with a given unique id and a name.

      • addCompetitor

        public Competitor addCompetitor(java.util.UUID id,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String shortName,
                       java.lang.String nationality,
                       CompetitorClass compClass)
        Adds a new competitor to this event.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier.
        name - the name of the competitor. May be null or non-unique.
        shortName - the short name of the competitor
        nationality - the nationality of the competitor
        compClass - the competitor class this competitor belongs to. May be null.
        Returns:
        the new competitor

      • addControlPoint

        public ControlPoint addControlPoint(java.util.UUID id,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           boolean hasTwoPoints)
        Adds a new control point to this event.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier.
        name - the name of the control point. May be null or non-unique.
        hasTwoPoints - true if this control point represents two marks/buoys, false if it represents only one.
        Returns:
        the new control point.

      • addControlPoint

        public ControlPoint addControlPoint(java.util.UUID id,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           boolean hasTwoPoints,
                           double lat1,
                           double lat2,
                           double lon1,
                           double lon2)
        Adds a new control point to this event.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier.
        name - the name of the control point. May be null or non-unique.
        hasTwoPoints - true if this control point represents two marks/buoys, false if it represents only one.
        lat1 - the latitude value for the first point
        lat2 - the latitude value for the second point
        lon1 - the longitude value for the first point
        lon2 - the longitude value for the second point
        Returns:
        the new control point.

      • addControlPoint

        public ControlPoint addControlPoint(java.util.UUID id,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String metadata,
                           boolean hasTwoPoints,
                           double lat1,
                           double lat2,
                           double lon1,
                           double lon2)
        Adds a new control point to this event.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier.
        name - the name of the control point. May be null or non-unique.
        metadata - the metadata associated with the control point
        hasTwoPoints - true if this control point represents two marks/buoys, false if it represents only one.
        lat1 - the latitude value for the first point
        lat2 - the latitude value for the second point
        lon1 - the longitude value for the first point
        lon2 - the longitude value for the second point
        Returns:
        the new control point.

      • addControlPoint

        public ControlPoint addControlPoint(java.util.UUID id,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String metadata,
                           boolean hasTwoPoints,
                           double lat1,
                           double lat2,
                           double lon1,
                           double lon2,
                           double m1,
                           double m2)
        Adds a new control point to this event.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier.
        name - the name of the control point. May be null or non-unique.
        metadata - the metadata associated with the control point
        hasTwoPoints - true if this control point represents two marks/buoys, false if it represents only one.
        lat1 - the latitude value for the first point
        lat2 - the latitude value for the second point
        lon1 - the longitude value for the first point
        lon2 - the longitude value for the second point
        m1 - the measurement value for the first point
        m2 - the measurement value for the second point
        Returns:
        the new control point.

        Returns:
